[SEC] 1. Introduction.[SUBSEC] 1.1 Purpose: The College Management System (CMS) defines authentication, records, enrollments, grading, and payments.
[SEC] 1. Introduction.[SUBSEC] 1.2 Scope: CMS supports registration, enrollments, grading, attendance, and secure payments.

[SUBSEC] 1.3 Product Perspective.[SUBSUBSEC] 1.3.1 System Interfaces: CMS integrates with student databases, LMS, and authentication services.
[SUBSEC] 1.3 Product Perspective.[SUBSUBSEC] 1.3.2 User Interfaces: CMS offers web and mobile dashboards.
[SUBSEC] 1.3 Product Perspective.[SUBSUBSEC] 1.3.3 Hardware Interfaces: CMS operates on cloud servers, supporting web and mobile.
[SUBSEC] 1.3 Product Perspective.[SUBSUBSEC] 1.3.5 Communications Interfa: CMS secures transactions via HTTPS, OAuth 2.0, and JWT.
[SUBSEC] 1.3 Product Perspective.[SUBSUBSEC] 1.3.6 Memory Constraints: CMS optimizes storage for student records.
[SUBSEC] 1.3 Product Perspective.[SUBSUBSEC] 1.3.9 Interfaces with Servic: CMS links with LMS, payments, and libraries.
[SUBSEC] 1.3 Product Perspective.[SUBSUBSEC] 1.3.4 MISSING-TAG2: CMS uses REST APIs for student data, courses, and grading.

[SEC] 1. Introduction.[SUBSEC] 1.4 Product Functions: CMS handles enrollments, grading, authentication, and transactions.
[SEC] 1. Introduction.[SUBSEC] 1.5 User Characteristics: Used by students, faculty, and admins.
[SEC] 1. Introduction.[SUBSEC] 1.7 Assumptions and Dependencie: CMS relies on authentication, cloud, and APIs.
[SUBSEC] 1.9 Acronyms and Abbreviations: FERPA: Family Educational Rights and Privacy Act
PCI-DSS: Payment Card Industry Data Security Standard
[SEC] 1. Introduction.[SUBSEC] 1.6 MISSING-TAG1: CMS needs internet for updates, authentication.

[SUBSEC] 2.1 External Interfaces.REQ-INTF-001: The system shall sync student records for enrollment (REQ-DB-001).
[SUBSEC] 2.1 External Interfaces.REQ-INTF-002: The system shall synchronize grades and attendance with LMS (REQ-FUNC-002).

[SUBSEC] 2.2 Functions.REQ-FUNC-001: The system shall enable course registration and profile management (REQ-DB-001, REQ-INTF-001).
[SUBSEC] 2.2 Functions.REQ-FUNC-002: The faculty shall manage grading, courses, with OAuth 2.0, JWT (REQ-DB-002, REQ-INTF-002).
[SUBSEC] 2.2 Functions.REQ-FUNC-003: The system shall process tuition payments securely (REQ-DB-003, REQ-INTF-001).

[SUBSEC] 2.3 Usability Requirements.REQ-USAB-001: The system shall offer a mobile-friendly dashboard (REQ-FUNC-001).

[SUBSEC] 2.4 Performance Requirements.REQ-PERF-001: The system shall process enrollments and payments within 3 seconds (REQ-FUNC-003).

[SUBSEC] 2.5 Logical Database Requiremen.REQ-DB-001: The system shall store student profiles and enrollments (REQ-FUNC-001).
[SUBSEC] 2.5 Logical Database Requiremen.REQ-DB-002: The system shall log authentication, enforce access control (REQ-FUNC-002).
[SUBSEC] 2.5 Logical Database Requiremen.REQ-DB-003: The system shall store tuition transactions (REQ-FUNC-003).

[SUBSEC] 2.6 Design Constraints.REQ-DSGN-001: The system shall implement role-based access control (REQ-DB-002).

[SUBSEC] 2.8 Software System Attributes.REQ-ATTR-001: The system shall log and encrypt student activities and payments (REQ-DB-003).

[SUBSEC] 2.7 MISSING-TAG3.REQ-COMP-001: The system shall comply with GDPR, FERPA, and PCI-DSS (REQ-DB-003).

[SEC] 3. Verification: Tests for enrollment, authentication, grading, and payments.
[SEC] 4. Supporting Information: User guides, API documentation, and compliance policies.
[SEC] 5. References: University policies, GDPR, FERPA, and PCI-DSS.
